description: The Arduino language is a set of C/C++ functions compiled with avr-g++ for robotics applications.
The chassis provides the frame and structural integrity for attaching all vehicle parts in robotics projects.
Choosing the right battery is essential in robotics projects as different types of batteries serve different needs.
Gears transmit and modify force and motion, enabling speed and direction changes in robotics applications.
Covers the foundational electronics knowledge needed for developing robotics systems.
An overview of motors used in robotics including DC, stepper, servo, and linear motors for various applications.
Leverage the Raspberry Piâ€™s hardware abstraction and Python programming for robotics projects.
Learn to program AVR microcontrollers in C using WinAVR compiler with Atmel Studio integration.
